| years3 = 2015 | clubs3 = → [[Ross County F.C.|Ross County]] (loan) | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015–2016 | clubs4 = → [[Bury F.C.|Bury]] (loan) | caps4 = 8 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps5 = 0 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Kilmarnock F.C.|Kilmarnock]] (loan) | caps6 = 11 | goals6 = 0 | pcupdate = 19:03, 27 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Austria national under-19 football team|Austria U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam2 = [[Austria national under-21 football team|Austria U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 16 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | ntupdate = }} '''Daniel Bachmann''' (born 9 July 1994) is an Austrian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for [[Kilmarnock F.C.|Kilmarnock]] on loan from [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].
Bachmann began his career with [[FK Austria Wien]] before joining Premier League club [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] in 2011 and signed a professional contract with the club in 2014. He has gained first-team experience by going out on loan to [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]], Scottish side [[Ross County F.C.|Ross County]] and [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].
==Career== ===Stoke City=== Bachmann began his career with [[FK Austria Wien]] before joining English side [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] in the summer of 2011. He played with Stoke's under-18 and under-21 squads and joined [[Conference Premier]] side [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]] on loan on 5 August 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=Goalkeeper Daniel Bachmann joins Wrexham|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Goalkeeper-Daniel-Bachmann-joins/story-22078515-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke's Daniel Bachmann extends Wrexham loan to season's end|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30684621|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> He played 18 times for the Dragons as they finished in 11th position.
Bachmann joined [[Scottish Premiership]] side [[Ross County F.C.|Ross County]] on a six-month loan in July 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ross County sign Daniel Bachmann and Jackson Irvine|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33698281|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> Bachmann made his professional debut on 8 August 2015, coming on for injured goalie [[Scott Fox]] in a 2–0 victory over [[Hamilton Academical F.C.|Hamilton Academical]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ross County 2-0 Hamilton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744501|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> On 31 August 2015, the loan deal was terminated by mutual consent after making just two appearances for the [[Victoria Park, Dingwall|Dingwall]] side.<ref>{{cite web|title=DEADLINE DAY TRANSFER NEWS |url=http://www.rosscountyfootballclub.co.uk/news/deadline-day-transfer-news/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151005085816/http://www.rosscountyfootballclub.co.uk/news/deadline-day-transfer-news/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=5 October 2015 |publisher=Ross County F.C. |date=31 August 2015 |accessdate=31 August 2015 }}</ref> On 28 October 2015, Bachmann joined [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Bury F.C.|Bury]] on a one-month loan.<ref>{{cite web|title=Daniel Bachmann: Stoke City keeper joins Bury on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34656830|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=28 October 2015}}</ref> His loan at [[Gigg Lane]] was extended until the beginning of January 2016 when he returned to Stoke after making ten appearances for the Shakers.<ref>{{cite web|title=FA CUP FULL TIME: Bury 0 Bradford City 0|url=http://www.burytimes.co.uk/sport/football/shakers/14193784.FA_CUP_FULL_TIME__Bury_0_Bradford_City_0/|website=Bury Times|accessdate=10 January 2016}}</ref>
Bachmann signed a one-year contract extension with Stoke in July 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=New Deal Pleases Bachmann|url=http://www.stokecityfc.com/news/article/2016-17/new-deal-pleases-bachmann-3179817.aspx|website=Stoke City|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> He was released by Stoke at the end of the [[2016–17 Stoke City F.C. season|2016–17]] season.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Potters Submit Retained List |url=http://www.stokecityfc.com/news/article/2016-17/potters-submit-retained-list-3725425.aspx |publisher=Stoke City Official Site |date=26 May 2017 |accessdate=26 May 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170526182549/http://www.stokecityfc.com/news/article/2016-17/potters-submit-retained-list-3725425.aspx |archivedate=26 May 2017 |df= }}</ref>
===Watford=== On 1 July 2017, Bachmann signed a three-year deal with [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Official: Watford Bag Bachmann |url=https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/official-watford-bag-bachmann |publisher=watfordfc.com |date=1 July 2017 |accessdate=1 July 2017}}</ref> On 8 August 2018, Bachmann joined [[Scottish Premiership]] side [[Kilmarnock F.C.|Kilmarnock]] on a season-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kilmarnockfc.co.uk/Article?id=7556|title=Daniel Bachmann joins Killie on season-long loan deal|publisher=[[Kilmarnock F.C.|Kilmarnock]]|date=8 August 2018|accessdate=8 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Bachmann played for several matches for Austria's youth teams and he made his debut for the [[Austria national under-21 football team|Austria U21]] side in September 2015 playing in a 2–0 victory against [[Azerbaijan national under-21 football team|Azerbaijan]].<ref>{{cite web|title=AZERBAIJAN U21 VS. AUSTRIA U21 0 - 2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/04/europe/uefa-u21-championship/azerbaijan-under-21/austria-under-21/2021462/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=9 October 2015}}</ref>
On 14 March 2017 he was called up to the [[Austria national football team|Austrian first team]] for the first time for games against [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]] and [[Finland national football team|Finland]].<ref>http://www.oefb.at/daniel-bachmann-und-stefan-lainer-news26553</ref>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 25 November 2018}}<ref>{{cite web|title=Daniel Bachmann|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=74189|website=Soccerbase|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref>
